snippet: When the Shelby A.C. Cobra was introduced at the New York auto show in 1962, it was well received. But few could have imagined that the upstart sports car would become one of the bluest of blue-chip classics.
abstract: Shelby Cobra, which was introduced at the 1962 New York auto show to modest applause, has gone on to become an automotive sex symbol and racetrack legend; cars now sell for up to $600,000.
lead_paragraph: When the Shelby A.C. Cobra was introduced at the New York auto show in 1962, it was well received. But few could have imagined that the upstart sports car would become one of the bluest of blue-chip classics.

headline.seo: Shelby’s Cobra at 50, Still an Icon of Sex and Power
headline.main: The Shelby Cobra at 50, an Icon of Sex and Power
headline.print_headline: Shelby Cobra at 50, An Icon of Sex and Power
